result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

8:52 AM Defendant Tara Renee Knauss appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances.  DEF indicates contact PD office and now qualifies for PD appointment.    Attny Pollak (Special Appearance) indicates no attorney has been appointed.   Court has discussion with DEF regarding right to have attorney present or proceed with initial appearance.  DEF indicates family members in gallery and wishes to have their input.   8:55 AM  OFF THE RECORD;   Attny Pollak indicates no attorney has been appointed.  Discussion takes place.   8:56 AM  BACK ON THE RECORD:   DEF wishes to proceed.    Attny Gabriel Pollak (special appearance) in court.    DEF received copy of criminal complaint in court on this date.  DEF verifies DOB and address.  Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint, wishes to contact counsel.   Court sets for preliminary hearing.
